summary: This document is an email chain from December 2024 between FBI personnel and mediator Simone Lelchuk regarding threats she is receiving in connection with the Epstein case. Lelchuk, who was involved as a mediator, expresses feeling threatened and seeks direction and protection, forwarding a harassing email she received. The FBI is inquiring if an AUSA can review the correspondence for potential statutory violations.

persons.name: Simone Lelchuk
persons.context: A mediator who states she is feeling threatened by communications related to the Epstein case and is seeking help and direction from law enforcement.

persons.name: Brad Edwards
persons.context: Copied on the email from Simone Lelchuk to the FBI, suggesting involvement in the Epstein case legal proceedings.

persons.name: Elise Frejka
persons.context: Primary recipient of Lelchuk's forwarded threatening email and copied on the follow-up to the FBI.

persons.name: Brittany Henderson
persons.context: Copied on the email from Simone Lelchuk to the FBI.

connections.description: Lelchuk copied Edwards on her email to the FBI regarding threats, indicating a professional connection in the Epstein case context.
Lelchuk directly emailed Frejka with a forwarded threatening message and later copied her on correspondence to the FBI.
Lelchuk copied Henderson on her email to the FBI regarding threats.

events.title: Threatening Email Received by Mediator
events.description: Simone Lelchuk receives a harassing and threatening email with the subject 'Deny, Defend, Depose' that references Epstein, Trump, Weinstein, and makes accusations against her and others.

events.title: Mediator Reports Threats to FBI
events.description: Simone Lelchuk contacts the FBI, expressing that she and others feel threatened and seeks specific direction and help, prompting an FBI internal inquiry about assigning an AUSA to review the correspondence.

keyFacts: In December 2024, mediator Simone Lelchuk, involved in the Epstein case, reported feeling threatened and received harassing communications, prompting her to contact the FBI for help.
The threatening email forwarded by Lelchuk contains aggressive rhetoric, accusing her and others of protecting 'adult JANE HOEs' and 'COCONSPIRATORS,' and references Epstein, Trump, and Weinstein.

The FBI internal email discusses whether an AUSA can be assigned to review dozens of correspondences received by Lelchuk to determine if they meet any statutory requirements for threats or harassment.
The document indicates ongoing fallout and potential harassment targeting individuals associated with the Epstein case years after the main events.
